cluster_relations.rel_desc: The king in the Rhodopis tale finds the lost slipper.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: NarrativeRole: discovery triggers recognition and marriage

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Hansel and Gretel discover a house made of sweets.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: after being abandoned in the woods

args.canonical_rel_desc: An agent encounters or finds an entity or location previously unknown or not in their possession within the narrative.
args.justification: Both relations describe a narrative discovery/encounter event where a character comes upon an important object or location (king finding the slipper; Hansel and Gretel discovering the sweet house). The semantics are equivalent and can be normalized under a single predicate 'discovers'.

These relations represent specific plot events (discovery of a key object/location) within stories, linking characters to narrative elements through an action. Grouping them under 'narrative_event_relation' captures this shared role in plot progression.

In both cases, animate agents (characters) actively perform an action upon an object/location in the narrative. The core semantics emphasize the acting subject and its directed action, which fits best under AGENCY.
